thread.title: Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri's Mani Bhavan visit cancelled
thread.title_full: Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri's Mani Bhavan visit cancelled | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna     | From the print edition
title: Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri's Mani Bhavan visit cancelled
text:
Former Pakistan foreign minister Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri, whose book launch faced a strong opposition from the Shiv Sena on Monday, was scheduled to visit Mani Bhavan to pay respect to the father of the nation, but the visit was cancelled due to "security reasons". The cancellation happened after Sena workers allegedly threw ink on function organiser and chairman of Observe Research Foundation Sudheendra Kulkarni, blackening his face.
Mani Bhavan, a modest two-storeyed building on Laburnum Road in the comparatively quiet locality called Gamdevi, served for about 17 eventful years (1917-1934) as the nerve centre in Bombay for Gandhiji's activities. It belonged to Shri Revashankar Jagjeevan Jhaveri, an ardent devotee of Gandhiji and his affectionate host during that period. Today, Mani Bhavan is a hallowed memorial to Gandhiji, to his stay here and to the activities he initiated from here.
As per the schedule, the Mani Bhavan administration got a call on Sunday, informing that Kasuri would pay a visit on Monday 2pm. But later, four police vans were seen parked outside the premises, and shortly after, the administration announced that the visit had been cancelled.
Every year, more than 3 lakh foreigners visit Mani Bhavan. Over the past few years, more than a thousand Pakistanis have visited the place.
Executive secretary of Mani Bhavan Gandhi Sangrahalaya Meghshyam Ajgaonkar said, "We got a call from the state government's protocol department, saying Mr Kasuri would visit on Monday. But for some reason, it was cancelled."
